item.title: Report I-2024110023
item.description:
Report I-2024110023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5001
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a HFS tank. He verified the tank, quantity, product, and connections before starting to air. The driver started the air and soon after it started to leak product from the top dome. The driver immediately shut it down and notified the customer and his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be over filled product.

item.title: Report E-2024110158
item.description:
Report E-2024110158

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN3295 Odorless Mineral Spirits release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents and placed into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024110173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor III Christopher Lewis contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Christopher stated that while they were unloading a 55-gallon plastic drum of UN1814, Potassium Hydroxide, Solution, 8, PG II, when they noticed that the drum was leaking around the cap. Christopher stated that roughly 1-ounce leaked on top of the drum. Christopher stated they moved the 55-gallon plastic drum to the Hazmat Bay.

item.title: Report E-2024110054
item.description:
Report E-2024110054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1907 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XUR. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Potassium perchlorate released from a 50-pound plastic bag due to improper loading by the shipper. The bag has a rip in it and is still wrapped on the pallet. The release impacted trailer #4633605 at dock door 14. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of Potassium Perchlorate product released to a 1x1’ area of the trailer floor due to bag being overfilled and excess product leaking from seam. They added cardboard bracing behind shrink-wrap to the area which had the release underneath, to add as extra layer of protection. The contractors containerized floor sweepings of product into (1) 55-gallon metal drum (with vented bung caps). The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110013
item.description:
Report E-2024110013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 25, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail of product were collected and containerized in two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110014
item.description:
Report E-2024110014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 25, 2024, four (4) 50-pound bags of UN1487 were torn in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) pound of product to the top of the bag. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged bags were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110012
item.description:
Report E-2024110012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon jugs of hydrogen peroxide were damaged in a freight handling incident and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged jugs in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal. TLE personnel then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All hydrogen peroxide-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately eighty (80) pounds of Sabostab UV70 released from two (2) plastic bags due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned spill and containerized spent product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100721
item.description:
Report E-2024100721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: WEST CHESTER

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon release of UN1263 Sherwin Williams Renewaire ROHS Paint from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum. Personnel advised they cleaned the release using oil dri absorbent. Dayton Freight advised the original drum was repaired and sent to the Consignee. Personnel completed cleanup and generated two (2) five (5) gallon poly drums of waste containing spent absorbent and released product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100108
item.description:
Report I-2024100108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As reported by Univar Operations Manager ..... . "Ross Transportation Services arrived at the Dayton branch to transport waste to Ross from Dayton. When the warehouse worker inspected the trailer to load he found liquid on the floor of the trailer. At the time there was no waste leaking from the trailer. The Ross driver was advised of the leaker and asked to pull out of the dock into the truck lot where we placed containment under the trailer to keep any of the waste from reaching the ground. At this point we have not determined which container is leaking for sure but believe it to by a flammable hazardous waste that is contained in a .275 gallon tote. It appears to be a very slow leak since none is escaping the trailer and the floor does not showing signs of significant leaking. Four totes of the same profile are loaded onto the rear of the Ross trailer. NRC was contacted for emergency response to handle the leaker and any clean up required. The ETA for the clean up contractor is 3:00 pm ET. There has been no exposure of employees nor any release to the ground. ER crew arrived on site and we determined the leaker was actually a DM of profile E80-9351A RIS which is a hazardous waste which is a flammable liquid, toxic and corrosive. It looks like less than a gallon escaped onto the trailer floor. The drum had a hole in the lower portion of the side of the drum which was allowing a very slow leak of the contents. The crew overpacked the drum using an overpack from Dayton branch. They used floor dry to clean up the trailer floor and placed the floor dry in the overpack with the drum. The overpack was labeled and loaded Back on the Ross trailer. The Dayton customer waste is being loaded onto the Ross trailer for shipment to Ross."

item.title: Report E-2024100610
item.description:
Report E-2024100610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of Potassium hydroxide released from a plastic tote due to a packaging error. Personnel advised the release impacted inside of a trailer and concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. The team generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbent and spilled product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100608
item.description:
Report E-2024100608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel advised the spill consisted of 2 different products: Sherwood CAB Blending White, and Sherwood KEMVAR. Personnel found two (2) metal pails of the KEMVAR that were crushed inside of a box by other freight stacked on top, causing approximately two (2) liters to leak out and impact and another box with 1 2-liter metal pail of the CAB Blending White. The team cleaned the spill with absorbents, they generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste. Personnel advised they generated a second (2nd) five (5) gallon poly drum containing the Sherwood CAB and KEMVAR containers. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Personnel advised the release impacted the trailer floor and dock. Dayton Freight personnel advised they cleaned spill using appropriate PPE available on site and Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel confirmed they generated one (1) twenty (20) gallon poly drum containing (1) metal pail product and spent Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
